title: Henley bans booze from tour
text:
Updated: 8:55 am 
Eagles star Don Henley has banned alcohol from his tour bus. 
Henley released his first solo album for 15 years on Sept. 26, but he will not be toasting its success during his upcoming North American concerts. 
Henley is imposing a booze ban on the tour to improve his performances, and he is also planning on enjoying early nights to avoid any partying. 
The rocker tells Britain's Daily Mirror newspaper, "It's certainly very different from the way I used to prepare to go on stage. Firstly, there is no alcohol on tour. Sleep is very important. I don't really have a social life - I stay in my room and I try to keep quiet." 
Henley's tour is due to kick off in Phoenix, Arizona on Saturday. Copyright WENN.com
